The gameplay is simple but well polished. The puzzles are creative and challenging but the game does a phenomenal job of teaching the player the mechanics as they play through the test chambers without holding their hand. The story is told superbly well through the Enrichment Centre's eerily empty hall's and the 'voice' that gets more and more sinister as the player progresses. 10/10.

Holy crap. Good game. It takes 2 hours to complete it your first time, but the reason I played for 10 hours is because of the achievements. Take's forever, especially just understanding what to do. Fun, annoying and full of rage! 10/10 would recommend.

The Portal series is probably one of the greatest puzzle games I've ever played to date as its so satisfying to complete Valve's tricky puzzles. This game has slightly aged however as once you've completed the game all thats left are the challenges which get boring after a while.

This game is a good quick short puzzle game which I highly recommend!

Verdict: Addicting First Person Puzzle game with great humor and engaging puzzles. A memorable experience that really brings home the "fun" factor too often missing in games nowadays,

Gameplay: You manipulate portals using a portal gun to complete a series of puzzles.  With both blue and orange portals, you can select your entrance and exit, and use these in clever ways, including sneaking up on turrets, looking from around corners, redirecting missiles, moving objects, and creating loops to gain speed and momentum.  You can also lift objects and stack them, like in Half-Life 2, to reach ledges.  This all allows for very creative, fluid, and engaging gameplay.  The pacing of the game is pretty much perfect, as well.

Visuals: At full quality, and despite its age, this game actually looks sharp, colorful, and overall pleasing to the eye.  The way light reflects off of your gun is also impressive for an older game like this.  The character model isn't smooth enough, but other than that, this game looks great.

Audio: Nothing to write home about.  The music is okay, and I have no complaints about the sounds.  The voice acting of the AI is well done and believable, and matches the humor perfectly.

Controls: You can adjust pretty much everything, like in Half-Life 2.  No problems here.  By default, use the left mouse key for the blue portal, and right for the orange, for fast-paced gameplay. No complaints.

Performance: Runs smoothly.  No frame rate drops for me except for when saving during dialogue or scene transitions, for which I can't blame the devs, because the game isn't divided into levels, but one fluid map.
Awesome game, I love the Dialogue from GLaDOS and the gameplay is super fun and rewarding to experiment with. It's instantly one of my favorite games.

Portal 1 is pretty short, yet this was one of my most memorable experiences from a video game. The introduction of the portal gun, creative level design, and atmosphere is what makes this game best in my opinion. 8.9/10

I haven't beaten this game yet, and I'm very confused. I really thought there would be more, but for $10, It's good. It has some really cool stuff the bends you're mind in good ways, and gets really hard. It's also amazing that there's no lag at all considering what has to happen in the program. Do I think this game is a little overrated? Yes. Do I still want you to play it? Yes. C'mon, it's only $10.

Edit: I beat the game, and now there are bonus levels, I take back what I said about the lack of content. Now go play it.

Культовая головоломка с некогда мозговыносящим геймплеем и милым, убедительным сюжетом сайфайного триллера. Раз в пару лет перепрохожу, отличный аперитив для сиквела — одной из лучших игр 2011.
Русский дубляж — образец из палаты мер и весов, как не надо подбирать актёров, переводить и озвучивать.
